intro: Xanthostemon francii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boxwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Xanthostemon francii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
